dlgLine.text: I've called this meeting because we have to make a decision that might affect everyone here. It's crucial that we weigh our options carefully if we want the people here to continue to trust us to make decisions. Some people might not like our solution - no one likes to swallow the bitter pill. But if at all possible, we should try to win as much support as is possible.

The issue we're having right now concerns our water supply. Our water is filtered through the school's purification system. However, the last few days, some people here feel that the water tastes a bit off.

It may be nothing, but if there's a problem with the purification system, we could be drinking contaminated water. I'm familiar with the system and I can handle the maintenance, but it's a question of how much time and material we want to devote to it, if at all.

Well, I haven't noticed anything off about the water. But I have seen what's out there and in my opinion, we need to use every bit of time and material have to make sure that this place can stand the worst of it.
I appreciate the difficulty of the situation, but every supply we have should be going into securing this place.
<To you> You've done alright so far, so... if you really think the water problem is a priority, I'll back up whatever solution you think is necessary.
My vote is for ignoring it for now and concentrating on all the other problems we have.
Being a leader means sometimes having to make unpopular decisions for the good of the group. Even if it's just to make yourself the bad guy to unite others.

I think the only solution - and one we perhaps should have started earlier - is to ration food. Nobody's going to like it, but if we all throw our weight behind the decision, perhaps people will understand.
<To you>But if you think we're better off going about this a different way, I'll support you.
Ration everyone's food for a week. It's the only way.
I don't care. As long as I get my food, I don't care what you do to everyone else here.
All I know is that I can't fly if I'm hallucinating because of an empty stomach.
<To you> But I know where my bread is occasionally buttered, so I'll throw in with whatever you decide.
So yeah... not really my problem. Try to ration me and maybe I'll look for work somewhere else.
Goddamn... Listening to these assholes you'd think the lot of you had been raised in luxury hotels your whole life.

Ooh - I don't want to eat bread crusts, I don't like creamed corn - fucking get over yourselves! You ever eaten prison food? Or seen what people in shithole towns across the border eat? You need to redefine 'food' if you want to live.
<To you> But you know, I guess I owe you, so if you need me to corral these bitches, I'll tell them to suck it up no matter what you decide.
People need to stop being so damn picky. Eat a beetle or a squirrel and shut the fuck up.
Given the circumstances we're in, I'm not sure why we're even putting this to a committee.
I don't think we should take any chances. I once did missionary work and I've seen what waterborne diseases can do to people.
<To you> But since you're usually willing to respect my opinion, I'm willing to defer to your judgment in this.
We shouldn't spare any time or material to get this fixed. We owe it to our residents to make sure they're drinking clean water.
It's probably just the heat or the smell in the air. Trust me, I've been to Mexico - I know what diseased water looks like.
We need to focus on what's important - keeping those freaks and killers out there from busting in here and killing us all!
<To you> But... people here seem to trust you, so I'll back you on this one, whatever your decision.
Our supplies should be used to fortify the school.

<To you> We'll do whatever you decide, but you should weigh the options carefully. If I take apart and fix the purification system, it's going to take quite a few parts and time, plus fuel to test it.

dlgAnsw.text: We don't have the resources to waste on it. We have bigger issues to worry about.
We need to make this a priority. Davis take whatever you need and get it done. <-30 parts, -1 gallon of fuel, -2 days of Davis' time>
I can only spare a few supplies. It might take longer, but I don't want to risk it. <-10 parts and 5 days of Davis' time>
As leaders, we should all ration our food for a week as a display of our commitment to the people here to solve this.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to conserve resources for other projects. Is this the final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is for me to use every resource I need to perform maintenance on the purification system. Are you sure you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: It looks like I'm going to have to jury-rig any repairs needed, which will probably take longer. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to immediately serve items that many here wouldn't normally eat to boost the immediate supply of food in the shelter. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: Then the decision is to hope that the purification system is working and use our resources for the defense of the shelter.
As it should be - good call. This frees us all up to make this place into more of a base of operations and less of a school.
As it should be - good call. This frees us all up to make this place into more of a base of operations and less of a school.
I think this might be risky, but I'll stand by you and I'll help out any way I can.
I can't support this. You're gambling our whole future on whatever happens over the course of the next few days.
This doesn't really mean any require any suffering from me. Perfect.
This doesn't really mean any require any suffering from me. Perfect.
Not what I would do, but... as long as you think it won't be an issue, I'm okay with this.
That sounds a lot like doing fuckall... Oh, wait - it is sitting around doing fuckall!
If you really think so... I said what I needed to, but if that's what you want, I'll back you this time.
That's disappointing and I don't think people are going to feel less safe. Having access to clean water seems like the definition of security to me.
I'm glad you see it that way. If we have to choose between being literally eaten alive and having the water taste funny, there's no other choice TO make.
I'm glad you see it that way. If we have to choose between being literally eaten alive and having the water taste funny, there's no other choice TO make.
VOID.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I'm not really on board with this... but I'll cash in one of my favors to you and go along with it.
That couldn't be farther from what I want. You want me to give up food for these people? I don't even know half their names.
Eat less? You know, I'll do it because I guess sometimes you don't make me regret coming here, but don't make this a regular thing.
You want ME to eat less?! What the hell kind of logic is that? We're in charge - if anything, it should be the other way around.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
It's a strong move... I like it. It sends the right message and buys good will in a way that nothing else will. Sure, we'll have to tighten our belts, but everyone will see us do it.
The decision is to make this a priority and use the necessary parts to get the job done sooner.
This is going to leave us vulnerable, but I guess you'll figure out something to address our security needs too.

And what if all those supplies and parts are wasted because there's no problem at all? You want to weaken our defensive options because there MAY be a problem with the goddamn water system? That's damn foolish.
People might complain, but it's better than starving later. It buys us some more time to work on building our food supply back up.
People might complain, but it's better than starving later. It buys us some more time to work on building our food supply back up.
I'm not wild about this at all... I'll support you on this, but you owe me.
I'm firmly against this. Nothing says desperate like trying to do more with less - it's a lie for stupid people by stupid people.
I'm really not into this... but since I owe you, I'll make people deal with it.
Give up food? Sure, kick us while we're down - that's going to go over real well.

You're making the right decision here. Even if there are those here that might think this is short-sighted, I think it speaks volumes about where our priorities are when it comes to taking care of our own.

You're making the right decision here. Even if there are those here that might think this is short-sighted, I think it speaks volumes about where our priorities are when it comes to taking care of our own.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
What are you doing? It's a waste! It's the damn nanny state they're so used to - people here need to just suck it up and concentrate on the greater threat!
The decision is to use fewer parts and try to do whatever can be done to do maintenance on the purification system.
This is going to leave us vulnerable, but I guess you'll figure out something to address our security needs too.
So.... a wishy-washy compromise that doesn't address either concern quickly. That's just fantastic...
I think this is a short-sighted plan. But I trust you to come up with a better strategy after this emergency measure plays out and I'll make sure everyone understands that.
Look, I've eaten my share of mystery food in the military, but these people aren't used to it and this is only going to bring morale down. Frankly, I think this is an ineffective solution.
If we're not rationing, then I'm not complaining. I'm okay with this.
If we're not rationing, then I'm not complaining. I'm okay with this.
Exactly. Food is food. You don't like how possum tastes, put some ketchup on it and quit your bitching.
Exactly. Food is food. You don't like how possum tastes, put some ketchup on it and quit your bitching.
I don't think this the kind of response everyone deserves, but at least you're doing something about it.
I don't believe this is the kind of response the people here deserve.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
Why are you trying to please everyone?! This is politics - compromise is for the weak!
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
That concludes our meeting... We've got a clear direction now. I'll let everyone know what you've decided.
